item.title: How Are Files and Directories Organized in Linux
item.author: debidong
item.description: Linux adopts a hierarchical file system structure, follows a "tree" structure, has a root directory, and extends downwards from the root directory to multiple subdirectories.

item.title: Linux Command Execution Bypass
item.author: debidong
item.description: Command execution bypass involves dealing with situations where a blacklist of keywords is in place to prevent specific actions or commands on a host.

item.title: Use Git and Use It Well
item.author: debidong
item.description: Git is a distributed version control system used to track changes in code and coordinate development among multiple individuals in a project. This article introduces the fundamental concepts and key terminology of Git, along with the usage of it.
